Package org.e2immu.annotation

Annotation Interface E2Container

@Retention(CLASS) @Target({FIELD,PARAMETER,METHOD,TYPE}) public @interface E2Container
Short-hand for the combination of E2Immutable and Container. It indicates that the type is effectively or eventually level 2 immutable, and a container at the same time.

  • Optional Element Summary

    Optional Elements
    Modifier and Type
    Optional Element
    Description
    boolean
    absent
    Parameter to mark that the annotation should be absent, or present.
    String
    after
    Marker for eventual immutability.
    boolean
    contract
    Parameter to set contract mode, even if the annotation occurs in a context where verification mode is normal.

  • Element Details

    • absent

      boolean absent
      Parameter to mark that the annotation should be absent, or present. In verification mode, absent=true means that an error will be raised if the analyser computes the annotation. In contract mode, it guarantees absence of the annotation.
      Returns:
      true when the annotation should be absent (verification mode) or must be absent (contract mode).
      Default:
      false

    • contract

      boolean contract
      Parameter to set contract mode, even if the annotation occurs in a context where verification mode is normal. Use contract=true to override the computation of the analyser.
      Returns:
      true when switching to contract mode.
      Default:
      false

    • after

      String after
      Marker for eventual immutability.
      Returns:
      when the type is effectively immutable, set the empty string. When it is eventually immutable, return a boolean expression of strings from @Mark values on some of the modifying methods of the type. After these have been called, the type will become effectively immutable.
      Default:
      ""
